Description: Deciduous conifers with soft, needle-like leaves that turn golden-yellow in fall
Habitat: Cold climates with plenty of moisture, often in mountainous regions and boreal forests
Maintenance: Prefers well-drained, loamy soil and full sun to partial shade; regular watering needed

Description: Evergreen conifers with needle-like leaves in clusters and distinctive cones
Habitat: Various environments, from sandy soils to rocky terrains, found in temperate and subtropical regions
Maintenance: Requires well-drained soil and full sun; drought-tolerant once established

Description: Tall, conical trees with soft, flat needles and distinctive cones
Habitat: Well-drained, moist soils, commonly found especially in mountainous areas
Maintenance: Prefers full sun and regular watering

Description: Evergreen trees with flat needles and upright cones, often used as Christmas trees
Habitat: Prefers cool, moist climates, found in mountainous areas
Maintenance: Thrives in well-drained, acidic soils; regular watering important

Description: Coniferous trees with stiff, sharp needle-like leaves and hanging cones
Habitat: Thrives in cold climates, commonly found in northern latitudes
Maintenance: Prefers well-drained, acidic soils and full sun; regular watering necessary

Description: Deciduous trees with broad leaves and acorns, varying in size and shape
Habitat: Various soils, from sandy to clay, found in temperate climates across
Maintenance: Prefers full sun and well-drained soil; drought-tolerant once established

Description: Deciduous trees with smooth gray bark and broad, serrated leaves; produces beechnuts
Habitat: Rich, moist soils, commonly found in temperate forests
Maintenance: Prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained, fertile soil; regular watering essential
